result.markdown: --- title: An overview of htmlwidgets description: | A brief overview of using htmlwidgets in R date: 2017-05-25 author: - name: Ella Kaye url: https://twitter.com/ellamkaye site-url: https://ellakaye.co.uk image: htmlwidgets-4.png # N.B. Don't use "" in image-alt image-alt: | A screenshot of the htmlwidgets website featuring clips of the cards for the DiagrammeR, leaflet, DT and tmap packages. #categories: # - TAG_1 # - TAG_2 twitter-card: # uncomment lines below for different title and description to post # title: | # description: | # uncomment for different image to post image: htmlwidgets-4.png image-alt: | A screenshot of the htmlwidgets website featuring clips of the cards for the DiagrammeR, leaflet, DT and tmap packages. # defaults to 500 x 500 summary: uncomment lines below for large card # image-width: 600 # image-height: 314 # card-style: "summary_large_image" draft: false --- ::: {.cell} ::: ` materials`{=html} ## Overview The [{htmlwidgets}](http://www.htmlwidgets.org/index.html){target="_blank"} package allows developers to create R bindings to JavaScript libraries. The resulting R packages allow the embedding of interactive content in R Markdown documents and Shiny web apps. There are over 50 available widgets. In this talk I give an overview of the `htmlwidget` framework and demonstrate the use of the [{DT}](https://rstudio.github.io/DT/){target="_blank"}, [{leaflet}](http://rstudio.github.io/leaflet/){target="_blank"} and [{DiagrammeR}](http://rich-iannone.github.io/DiagrammeR/){target="_blank"} packages. ## Event details **Event:** [Warwick R User Group](https://warwick.ac.uk/fac/sci/wdsi/events/wrug/){target="_blank"} **Date:** May 25th, 2017 **Time:** 17:00 **Location:** University of Warwick
